fields.title: Quiz with Ginja Ninja
fields.content: Join us for a quiz like no other, hosted inside our beautiful venue by our very own bar manager Ross 'Ginja Ninja' Smith. Drinks, laughs and prizes to be won.
fields.excerpt: £2 per person to play, max 6 per team. Please email ross@printersplayhouse.co.uk to ‘book your bubble’.

fields.title: Troubadours - Ben Walker + Kirsty Merryn
fields.content:
"Troubadours" is the regular roots music evening at PPH featuring top artists in folk, country, acoustic rock and everything in between - plus local support!

Ben Walker and Kirsty Merryn.... Saturday 20th November.  8 pm.  In The Playhouse.  Tickets £8 
Supported by Hayley Savage

BBC Folk Award Winner Ben Walker joins forces with highly acclaimed singer and pianist Kirsty Merryn to create a fresh take on a tradition ripe for rediscovery...

"Life and the Land" is a celebration of England's harvest tradition, re-imagining songs born out of our agricultural past.

Ben Walker was recently hailed as 'one of the best acoustic guitarists in the world right now' (Total Guitar magazine) and 'a great guitarist composer and producer' (Mark Radcliffe, BBC Folk Show).  With his work sought out from punk to Proms, from Rough Trade to the Royal Shakespeare Company, his passion is putting old jewels into new settings.  He has been involved in over 50 albums as performer and producer, and his new solo LP 'Echos' has received universal critical acclaim. 

Kirsty Merryn launched her debut album 'She and I' in 2017 whilst supporting folk behemoths Show of Hands on their UK cathedrals tour.  Her follow-up 'Our Bright Night' was chosen by The Guardian as their Folk Album of the Month.

fields.title: Room To Rant
fields.content:
Room to Rant is a space for young men to rap and get stuff off their chest.

The rap and spoken word initiative that tackles men’s mental health is in action across Brighton, Worthing, Crawley, Eastbourne and online. 

The rap sessions are led by highly-experienced and accomplished rappers who are well respected in the  Brighton hip-hop and music scene. Members are encouraged to be themselves; talking and exploring struggles and life experiences through spoken word, rap and hip hop.   

No prior rapping experience is needed at these relaxed, free-to-attend, weekly drop-ins, where young men build on lyric-writing and improvisation skills. The groups can still meet despite Covid-19 and there is one online group for those who can’t meet in-person. Anyone who identifies as male or non-binary aged 16-25  is welcome to attend Room To Rant.
fields.excerpt: Mondays, 18.30 till 20.30 Free

fields.title: Olioke
fields.content: Join Oli for our free fun Thursday night of karaoke and cocktails, with wigs and wine, beer and a bit of bonkers. Build your confidence and warm up your voice with group sing-alongs, or belt out your fave karaoke songs on our bar stage!
fields.excerpt:
7:30pm till close (last song at 23:30)
Go to www.olioke.uk to see what songs we have available

fields.title: Wendy Saves Santa
fields.content: Wendy is having 'issues', she can't cope with modern life but she'd rather find her answers at the bottom of a glass rather than in the company of friends. But then an old friend...from Neverland...pays her a visit and whisks her away to the far off magical land to save the day once more, because Captain Hook is having no trouble at all coping with modern life...he's making a million a day exploiting the dreams of children, and he's even gone so far as to kidnap Santa to get what he wants. Can Wendy save Christmas Day for all the children around the world? Come to Printer's Playhouse over Christmas to find out.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets: £14, Concession £11, Child £8
Plus Booking Fee

fields.content: Fly Half is a new play by Gary Lagden, with original songs by Gareth Moulton that tells the story of a rugby playing steelworker from South Wales. A lyrical hymn to one man’s passion for his family, his town and his beloved game of rugby. Set in an industrial town, this play is a celebration of working class families who head out to the game each week, stand pitch side with pride, supporting their local grassroots team. Fly Half is a story of love, loss, community and sport, that rages against the beige of modern life.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets £14.00 (plus booking fee).

Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

fields.title: Holding Space
fields.content:
If you are a parent/carer looking after a child who is struggling with their mental health why not pop in and meet other parents. 

Relaxed group offering a safe, confidential space; time to chat, connect and share with one another. Know that you are not alone as a parent.
fields.excerpt: Holding Space is a free Monthly group starting Thursdays 10am-11.30am

fields.title: Ringing the Devil's Doorbell
fields.content:
'Ringing the Devil’s Doorbell' is the third in a series of monologues
exploring characters from Twelfth Night and will next year be
incorporated into one show to be called ‘The Twelfth Night Trilogy’
(though will also remain as a separate solo play). The Devil’s
Doorbell sees Viola confronting issues of identity, sexuality and
hidden agendas in a world of masks and disguises. It opens with
Viola in the aftermath of the destruction of the club Jo Jo. The play
contains live music from actress and accomplished accordion
player Hannah Harris, with songs by Jacques Brel.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets: £14, Concession £11, Child £8
Plus Booking Fee

Looking for a creative community? Join our all abilities art group, a relaxed space to bring your own art work, share ideas or dabble in something new.
fields.excerpt: All abilities welcome to share and make art in a supportive environment.

fields.title: Olioke
fields.content: Join Oli for our free fun Thursday night of karaoke and cocktails, with wigs and wine, beer and a bit of bonkers. Build your confidence and warm up your voice with group sing-alongs, or belt out your fave karaoke songs on our bar stage!
fields.excerpt:
7:30pm till close (last song at 23:30)
Go to www.olioke.uk to see what songs we have available

fields.title: Room To Rant
fields.content:
Room to Rant is a space for young men to rap and get stuff off their chest.

The rap and spoken word initiative that tackles men’s mental health is in action across Brighton, Worthing, Crawley, Eastbourne and online. 

The rap sessions are led by highly-experienced and accomplished rappers who are well respected in the  Brighton hip-hop and music scene. Members are encouraged to be themselves; talking and exploring struggles and life experiences through spoken word, rap and hip hop.   

No prior rapping experience is needed at these relaxed, free-to-attend, weekly drop-ins, where young men build on lyric-writing and improvisation skills. The groups can still meet despite Covid-19 and there is one online group for those who can’t meet in-person. Anyone who identifies as male or non-binary aged 16-25  is welcome to attend Room To Rant.
fields.excerpt: Mondays, 18.30 till 20.30 Free

fields.title: Wendy Saves Santa
fields.content: Wendy is having 'issues', she can't cope with modern life but she'd rather find her answers at the bottom of a glass rather than in the company of friends. But then an old friend...from Neverland...pays her a visit and whisks her away to the far off magical land to save the day once more, because Captain Hook is having no trouble at all coping with modern life...he's making a million a day exploiting the dreams of children, and he's even gone so far as to kidnap Santa to get what he wants. Can Wendy save Christmas Day for all the children around the world? Come to Printer's Playhouse over Christmas to find out.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets: £14, Concession £11, Child £8
Plus Booking Fee

fields.title: PPH Birthday Party
fields.content:
Join the PPH family from 7.30pm in celebrating another year at Grove Road and over 6 years of being the best Theatre, Live Music Venue and Arts Hub in Eastbourne!

We have a jam packed line up of Game show games, performances from the choir and The Ukulele Army, a special Open Stage set and live music from The Great Fire!

Theme is Black and Gold, so get your PPH colours on and make sure you've booked your table by emailing ross@printersplayhouse.co.uk

fields.title: Beginners Chair Yoga
fields.content:
Ashley from Lotus Lessons will support you through a gentle chair based practice that is focused on mindful movement and meditation.

Sessions are accessible for all with modifications given where needed.
fields.excerpt: Beginners Yoga - Weekly £10 Thur 1pm-12pm

fields.content: Fancy something a little different, why not try learning the ukulele. All welcome once again to play along and/or watch the from 7.30pm
fields.excerpt: £3 to take part. Free to watch.

fields.title: Fly Half
fields.content: Fly Half is a new play by Gary Lagden, with original songs by Gareth Moulton that tells the story of a rugby playing steelworker from South Wales. A lyrical hymn to one man’s passion for his family, his town and his beloved game of rugby. Set in an industrial town, this play is a celebration of working class families who head out to the game each week, stand pitch side with pride, supporting their local grassroots team. Fly Half is a story of love, loss, community and sport, that rages against the beige of modern life.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets £14.00 (plus booking fee).

Book tickets through Online Ticket Seller, or in venue.

fields.title: Play Reading Workshops
fields.content:
£60 per course £10 per session.
Starts Monday September 20th 1-3pm 

6 week script reading course, 2 hour workshop each week reading a full script. 
Looking at the things we did/didn’t like, giving feedback on the project. 

Email us to book: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk
fields.excerpt:
£60 per course £10 per session.
Jan 10th to Feb 14th
Mondays 1-3pm

fields.title: IMPROBOOTS
fields.content:
Improvisation is a skill used in all walks of life to build confidence, free the imagination and improve communication. It's also a huge amount of fun. 
Join us for our inclusive, accessible, *failure free* environment for games, exercises and challenges 
led by actor/director Florence Bell.
fields.excerpt:
£60 per course, £10 per session
Jan 11th to Feb 15th
Tuesdays at 12.30 - 2.30pm
Email us to book: info@printersplayhouse.co.uk

fields.title: PPH New Years Eve Party
fields.content:
End this year with a real bang by joining us for the best New Years Eve Party Ever!!

Join us for a fun filled night of Olioke Karaoke and PPH Zoom fave SINGO! (Bingo with songs)  

Tickets only £10 including a toast drink..
fields.excerpt: £10 plus booking fee

Musicians, poets, storytellers, comedians are all welcome! Basically anyone who needs a mic to express their art.
